natural solution: &= \frac{4 \cos \frac{\pi}{7} \cos \frac{\pi}{14} - 4 \sin \frac{2 \pi}{7} \cos \frac{2 \pi}{7}}{\sin \frac{2 \pi}{7}}. \end{align}Then by product-to-sum and double angle formula, \begin{align} \frac{4 \cos \frac{\pi}{7} \cos \frac{\pi}{14} - 4 \sin \frac{2 \pi}{7} \cos \frac{2 \pi}{7}}{\sin \frac{2 \pi}{7}} &= \frac{2 (\cos \frac{3 \pi}{14} + \cos \frac{\pi}{14}) - 2 \sin \frac{4 \pi}{7}}{\sin \frac{2 \pi}{7}} \\

a_0.formal problem:
theorem
fixes pi :: real
assumes h0 : "pi = 3.14159265358979323846"
shows  "csc (pi / 14) - 4 * cos (2 * pi / 7) = 2"
a_0.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Compute
\[\csc \frac{\pi}{14} - 4 \cos \frac{2 \pi}{7}.\] The final Answer is 2
 ### Proof
 We can write \begin{align} \csc \frac{\pi}{14} - 4 \cos \frac{2 \pi}{7} &= \frac{1}{\sin \frac{\pi}{14}} - 4 \cos \frac{2 \pi}{7} \\ &= \frac{2 \cos \frac{\pi}{14}}{2 \cos \frac{\pi}{14} \sin \frac{\pi}{14}} - 4 \cos \frac{2 \pi}{7}.
 \end{align}By double-angle formula, \begin{align} \frac{2 \cos \frac{\pi}{14}}{2 \cos \frac{\pi}{14} \sin \frac{\pi}{14}} - 4 \cos \frac{2 \pi}{7} &= \frac{2 \cos \frac{\pi}{14}}{\sin \frac{\pi}{7}} - 4 \cos \frac{2 \pi}{7} \\
 &= \frac{4 \cos \frac{\pi}{7} \cos \frac{\pi}{14}}{2 \cos \frac{\pi}{7} \sin \frac{\pi}{7}} - 4 \cos \frac{2 \pi}{7} \\ &= \frac{4 \cos \frac{\pi}{7} \cos \frac{\pi}{14}}{\sin \frac{2 \pi}{7}} - 4 \cos \frac{2 \pi}{7} \\
 &= \frac{4 \cos \frac{\pi}{7} \cos \frac{\pi}{14} - 4 \sin \frac{2 \pi}{7} \cos \frac{2 \pi}{7}}{\sin \frac{2 \pi}{7}}. \end{align}Then by product-to-sum and double angle formula, \begin{align} \frac{4 \cos \frac{\pi}{7} \cos \frac{\pi}{14} - 4 \sin \frac{2 \pi}{7} \cos \frac{2 \pi}{7}}{\sin \frac{2 \pi}{7}} &= \frac{2 (\cos \frac{3 \pi}{14} + \cos \frac{\pi}{14}) - 2 \sin \frac{4 \pi}{7}}{\sin \frac{2 \pi}{7}} \\
 &= \frac{2 \sin \frac{2 \pi}{7} + 2 \sin \frac{3 \pi}{7} - 2 \sin \frac{4 \pi}{7}}{\sin \frac{2 \pi}{7}} \\ &= \frac{2 \sin \frac{2 \pi}{7}}{\sin \frac{2 \pi}{7}} \\ &= \boxed{2}. \end{align}
 *)

fixes pi :: real

shows  "csc (pi / 14) - 4 * cos (2 * pi / 7) = 2"

theorem
fixes pi :: real
assumes h0 : "pi = 3.14159265358979323846264338327950288"
shows  "csc(pi / 14) - 4 * cos(2 * pi / 7) = 2"
a_1.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Compute
\[\csc \frac{\pi}{14} - 4 \cos \frac{2 \pi}{7}.\] The final Answer is 2
 ### Proof
 We can write \begin{align} \csc \frac{\pi}{14} - 4 \cos \frac{2 \pi}{7} &= \frac{1}{\sin \frac{\pi}{14}} - 4 \cos \frac{2 \pi}{7} \\ &= \frac{2 \cos \frac{\pi}{14}}{2 \cos \frac{\pi}{14} \sin \frac{\pi}{14}} - 4 \cos \frac{2 \pi}{7}.
 \end{align}By double-angle formula, \begin{align} \frac{2 \cos \frac{\pi}{14}}{2 \cos \frac{\pi}{14} \sin \frac{\pi}{14}} - 4 \cos \frac{2 \pi}{7} &= \frac{2 \cos \frac{\pi}{14}}{\sin \frac{\pi}{7}} - 4 \cos \frac{2 \pi}{7} \\
 &= \frac{4 \cos \frac{\pi}{7} \cos \frac{\pi}{14}}{2 \cos \frac{\pi}{7} \sin \frac{\pi}{7}} - 4 \cos \frac{2 \pi}{7} \\ &= \frac{4 \cos \frac{\pi}{7} \cos \frac{\pi}{14}}{\sin \frac{2 \pi}{7}} - 4 \cos \frac{2 \pi}{7} \\
 &= \frac{4 \cos \frac{\pi}{7} \cos \frac{\pi}{14} - 4 \sin \frac{2 \pi}{7} \cos \frac{2 \pi}{7}}{\sin \frac{2 \pi}{7}}. \end{align}Then by product-to-sum and double angle formula, \begin{align} \frac{4 \cos \frac{\pi}{7} \cos \frac{\pi}{14} - 4 \sin \frac{2 \pi}{7} \cos \frac{2 \pi}{7}}{\sin \frac{2 \pi}{7}} &= \frac{2 (\cos \frac{3 \pi}{14} + \cos \frac{\pi}{14}) - 2 \sin \frac{4 \pi}{7}}{\sin \frac{2 \pi}{7}} \\
 &= \frac{2 \sin \frac{2 \pi}{7} + 2 \sin \frac{3 \pi}{7} - 2 \sin \frac{4 \pi}{7}}{\sin \frac{2 \pi}{7}} \\ &= \frac{2 \sin \frac{2 \pi}{7}}{\sin \frac{2 \pi}{7}} \\ &= \boxed{2}. \end{align}
 *)

a_2.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Compute

 ### Proof
 We can write \begin{align} \csc \frac{\pi}{14} - 4 \cos \frac{2 \pi}{7} &= \frac{1}{\sin \frac{\pi}{14}} - 4 \cos \frac{2 \pi}{7} \\ &= \frac{2 \cos \frac{\pi}{14}}{2 \cos \frac{\pi}{14} \sin \frac{\pi}{14}} - 4 \cos \frac{2 \pi}{7}.
 \end{align}By double-angle formula, \begin{align} \frac{2 \cos \frac{\pi}{14}}{2 \cos \frac{\pi}{14} \sin \frac{\pi}{14}} - 4 \cos \frac{2 \pi}{7} &= \frac{2 \cos \frac{\pi}{14}}{\sin \frac{\pi}{7}} - 4 \cos \frac{2 \pi}{7} \\
 &= \frac{4 \cos \frac{\pi}{7} \cos \frac{\pi}{14}}{2 \cos \frac{\pi}{7} \sin \frac{\pi}{7}} - 4 \cos \frac{2 \pi}{7} \\ &= \frac{4 \cos \frac{\pi}{7} \cos \frac{\pi}{14}}{\sin \frac{2 \pi}{7}} - 4 \cos \frac{2 \pi}{7} \\
 &= \frac{4 \cos \frac{\pi}{7} \cos \frac{\pi}{14} - 4 \sin \frac{2 \pi}{7} \cos \frac{2 \pi}{7}}{\sin \frac{2 \pi}{7}}. \end{align}Then by product-to-sum and double angle formula, \begin{align} \frac{4 \cos \frac{\pi}{7} \cos \frac{\pi}{14} - 4 \sin \frac{2 \pi}{7} \cos \frac{2 \pi}{7}}{\sin \frac{2 \pi}{7}} &= \frac{2 (\cos \frac{3 \pi}{14} + \cos \frac{\pi}{14}) - 2 \sin \frac{4 \pi}{7}}{\sin \frac{2 \pi}{7}} \\
 &= \frac{2 \sin \frac{2 \pi}{7} + 2 \sin \frac{3 \pi}{7} - 2 \sin \frac{4 \pi}{7}}{\sin \frac{2 \pi}{7}} \\ &= \frac{2 \sin \frac{2 \pi}{7}}{\sin \frac{2 \pi}{7}} \\ &= \boxed{2}. \end{align}
 *)

a_3.formal problem:
theorem
fixes pi :: real
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. csc x = 1 / sin x"
and h1 : "\<forall> x. cos (2 * x) = 1 - 2 * sin x powr 2"
and h2 : "sin (pi / 14) \<noteq> 0"
and h3 : "sin (2 * pi / 7) \<noteq> 0"
shows  "csc (pi / 14) - 4 * cos (2 * pi / 7) = 2"
a_3.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Compute
\[\csc \frac{\pi}{14} - 4 \cos \frac{2 \pi}{7}.\] The final Answer is 2
 ### Proof
 We can write \begin{align} \csc \frac{\pi}{14} - 4 \cos \frac{2 \pi}{7} &= \frac{1}{\sin \frac{\pi}{14}} - 4 \cos \frac{2 \pi}{7} \\ &= \frac{2 \cos \frac{\pi}{14}}{2 \cos \frac{\pi}{14} \sin \frac{\pi}{14}} - 4 \cos \frac{2 \pi}{7}.
 \end{align}By double-angle formula, \begin{align} \frac{2 \cos \frac{\pi}{14}}{2 \cos \frac{\pi}{14} \sin \frac{\pi}{14}} - 4 \cos \frac{2 \pi}{7} &= \frac{2 \cos \frac{\pi}{14}}{\sin \frac{\pi}{7}} - 4 \cos \frac{2 \pi}{7} \\
 &= \frac{4 \cos \frac{\pi}{7} \cos \frac{\pi}{14}}{2 \cos \frac{\pi}{7} \sin \frac{\pi}{7}} - 4 \cos \frac{2 \pi}{7} \\ &= \frac{4 \cos \frac{\pi}{7} \cos \frac{\pi}{14}}{\sin \frac{2 \pi}{7}} - 4 \cos \frac{2 \pi}{7} \\
 &= \frac{4 \cos \frac{\pi}{7} \cos \frac{\pi}{14} - 4 \sin \frac{2 \pi}{7} \cos \frac{2 \pi}{7}}{\sin \frac{2 \pi}{7}}. \end{align}Then by product-to-sum and double angle formula, \begin{align} \frac{4 \cos \frac{\pi}{7} \cos \frac{\pi}{14} - 4 \sin \frac{2 \pi}{7} \cos \frac{2 \pi}{7}}{\sin \frac{2 \pi}{7}} &= \frac{2 (\cos \frac{3 \pi}{14} + \cos \frac{\pi}{14}) - 2 \sin \frac{4 \pi}{7}}{\sin \frac{2 \pi}{7}} \\
 &= \frac{2 \sin \frac{2 \pi}{7} + 2 \sin \frac{3 \pi}{7} - 2 \sin \frac{4 \pi}{7}}{\sin \frac{2 \pi}{7}} \\ &= \frac{2 \sin \frac{2 \pi}{7}}{\sin \frac{2 \pi}{7}} \\ &= \boxed{2}. \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes pi :: real
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. csc x = 1 / sin x"
and h1 : "\<forall> x. cos (2 * x) = 1 - 2 * sin x powr 2"
and h2 : "sin (pi / 14) \<noteq> 0"
and h3 : "sin (2 * pi / 7) \<noteq> 0"
shows  "csc (pi / 14) - 4 * cos (2 * pi / 7) = 2"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_3.informal problem: "If the cosecant of an angle is defined as the reciprocal of the sine of that angle, and the cosine of twice an angle is given by the relation $1 - 2 \times (\sin x)^2$, find the value of the expression $csc(\pi/14) - 4 \times cos(2\pi/7)$ given that the sine of $\pi/14$ and $2\pi/7$ are not zero. The final answer is $2$."

fixes x :: real
assumes h0 : "x = pi / 14"
and h1 : "csc x - 4 * cos (2 * pi / 7) = 2"
shows  "2 = 2"
a_4.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Compute
\[\csc \frac{\pi}{14} - 4 \cos \frac{2 \pi}{7}.\] The final Answer is 2
 ### Proof
 We can write \begin{align} \csc \frac{\pi}{14} - 4 \cos \frac{2 \pi}{7} &= \frac{1}{\sin \frac{\pi}{14}} - 4 \cos \frac{2 \pi}{7} \\ &= \frac{2 \cos \frac{\pi}{14}}{2 \cos \frac{\pi}{14} \sin \frac{\pi}{14}} - 4 \cos \frac{2 \pi}{7}.
 \end{align}By double-angle formula, \begin{align} \frac{2 \cos \frac{\pi}{14}}{2 \cos \frac{\pi}{14} \sin \frac{\pi}{14}} - 4 \cos \frac{2 \pi}{7} &= \frac{2 \cos \frac{\pi}{14}}{\sin \frac{\pi}{7}} - 4 \cos \frac{2 \pi}{7} \\
 &= \frac{4 \cos \frac{\pi}{7} \cos \frac{\pi}{14}}{2 \cos \frac{\pi}{7} \sin \frac{\pi}{7}} - 4 \cos \frac{2 \pi}{7} \\ &= \frac{4 \cos \frac{\pi}{7} \cos \frac{\pi}{14}}{\sin \frac{2 \pi}{7}} - 4 \cos \frac{2 \pi}{7} \\
 &= \frac{4 \cos \frac{\pi}{7} \cos \frac{\pi}{14} - 4 \sin \frac{2 \pi}{7} \cos \frac{2 \pi}{7}}{\sin \frac{2 \pi}{7}}. \end{align}Then by product-to-sum and double angle formula, \begin{align} \frac{4 \cos \frac{\pi}{7} \cos \frac{\pi}{14} - 4 \sin \frac{2 \pi}{7} \cos \frac{2 \pi}{7}}{\sin \frac{2 \pi}{7}} &= \frac{2 (\cos \frac{3 \pi}{14} + \cos \frac{\pi}{14}) - 2 \sin \frac{4 \pi}{7}}{\sin \frac{2 \pi}{7}} \\
 &= \frac{2 \sin \frac{2 \pi}{7} + 2 \sin \frac{3 \pi}{7} - 2 \sin \frac{4 \pi}{7}}{\sin \frac{2 \pi}{7}} \\ &= \frac{2 \sin \frac{2 \pi}{7}}{\sin \frac{2 \pi}{7}} \\ &= \boxed{2}. \end{align}
 *)

\[\csc \frac{\pi}{14} - 4 \cos \frac{2 \pi}{7}.\] The final Answer is 2
 ### Proof
 We can write \begin{align} \csc \frac{\pi}{14} - 4 \cos \frac{2 \pi}{7} &= \frac{1}{\sin \frac{\pi}{14}} - 4 \cos \frac{2 \pi}{7} \\ &= \frac{2 \cos \frac{\pi}{14}}{2 \cos \frac{\pi}{14} \sin \frac{\pi}{14}} - 4 \cos \frac{2 \pi}{7}.
 \end{align}By double-angle formula, \begin{align} \frac{2 \cos \frac{\pi}{14}}{2 \cos \frac{\pi}{14} \sin \frac{\pi}{14}} - 4 \cos \frac{2 \pi}{7} &= \frac{2 \cos \frac{\pi}{14}}{\sin \frac{\pi}{7}} - 4 \cos \frac{2 \pi}{7} \\
 &= \frac{4 \cos \frac{\pi}{7} \cos \frac{\pi}{14}}{2 \cos \frac{\pi}{7} \sin \frac{\pi}{7}} - 4 \cos \frac{2 \pi}{7} \\ &= \frac{4 \cos \frac{\pi}{7} \cos \frac{\pi}{14}}{\sin \frac{2 \pi}{7}} - 4 \cos \frac{2 \pi}{7} \\
 &= \frac{4 \cos \frac{\pi}{7} \cos \frac{\pi}{14} - 4 \sin \frac{2 \pi}{7} \cos \frac{2 \pi}{7}}{\sin \frac{2 \pi}{7}}. \end{align}Then by product-to-sum and double angle formula, \begin{align} \frac{4 \cos \frac{\pi}{7} \cos \frac{\pi}{14} - 4 \sin \frac{2 \pi}{7} \cos \frac{2 \pi}{7}}{\sin \frac{2 \pi}{7}} &= \frac{2 (\cos \frac{3 \pi}{14} + \cos \frac{\pi}{14}) - 2 \sin \frac{4 \pi}{7}}{\sin \frac{2 \pi}{7}} \\
 &= \frac{2 \sin \frac{2 \pi}{7} + 2 \sin \frac{3 \pi}{7} - 2 \sin \frac{4 \pi}{7}}{\sin \frac{2 \pi}{7}} \\ &= \frac{2 \sin \frac{2 \pi}{7}}{\sin \frac{2 \pi}{7}} \\ &= \boxed{2}. \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes pi :: real
assumes h0 : "pi = 22/7"
shows  "csc(pi / 14) - 4 * cos(2 * pi / 7) = 2"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_9.informal problem: Determine the value of $\csc(\frac{\pi}{14}) - 4\cos(\frac{2\pi}{7})$ if $\pi$ is approximated as $\frac{22}{7}$. The final answer is $2$.
